title: Discord: How to Turn Off the Overlay on Desktop and Android

steps.title: Open Discord and click the cogwheel next to your name.
steps.content: Open Discord and click the cogwheel next to your name. This will bring you to your Discord settings. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and select Game Overlay.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Game Overlay . The option is under Activity Settings . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Toggle off "Enable in-game overlay".
steps.content: Toggle off "Enable in-game overlay". This will turn off the Discord overlay for every game on your computer. If you want it back, you'll have to go back into your settings and toggle it back on. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open Discord and click the cogwheel next to your name.
steps.content: Open Discord and click the cogwheel next to your name. This will bring you to your Discord settings. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll down and select Registered Games.
steps.content: Scroll down and select Registered Games . The option is under Activity Settings . [5] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll until you see the game you want to have the overlay on.
steps.content: Scroll until you see the game you want to have the overlay on. All of the games you've recently played that Discord on PC or Mac has detected will be on the list. [6] X Research source If you don't see your game on the list, open the game and click Add it! at the top of the Registered Games menu screen, beneath the box that says No game detected . Select your game from the dropdown and click Add Game .

steps.title: Click the screen icon next to the game.
steps.content: Click the screen icon next to the game. The screen icon should turn red with a line through it. This will disable the Discord overlay for that specific game when you play it.

steps.title: Open the Discord app.
steps.content: Open the Discord app. If you have an Android phone and have updated Discord to Version 9.4.5, there is a mobile overlay as well. There is currently no mobile overlay for the iPhone version of Discord. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Open your Discord settings and scroll to Voice & Video.
steps.content: Open your Discord settings and scroll to Voice & Video . You should see an option to enable the mobile voice overlay.

steps.title: Toggle off the "Enable Mobile Voice Overlay" toggle.
steps.content: Toggle off the "Enable Mobile Voice Overlay" toggle. This will turn off the mobile overlay so you don't see it when you're in a Discord voice chat and also playing a game on your phone.
